topic: a year after la-area wildfires destroyed thousands of homes, fewer than a dozen have been rebuilt

text: It's been a year since devastating wildfires swept through the LA area
Leaving a trail of destruction and thousands of families without homes
The wildfires destroyed over five thousand homes in the LA area
Many more homes were damaged, and the affected communities are still struggling to recover
The rebuild process has been hindered by bureaucratic delays and insurance disputes
A shortage of skilled labor has slowed down the construction of new homes
Only eleven homes have been fully rebuilt and certified for occupancy
Hundreds of families are still waiting for their homes to be reconstructed or repaired
Many are left wondering what the future holds for these communities
An investigation is underway to determine whether more could have been done
To expedite the recovery process and get families back into their homes sooner
The recovery process has been slow and painful for the affected communities
The impact of the wildfires is still being felt a year later
And it may take years for the communities to fully recover
